data.text: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva (@KGeorgieva) comments on the impact of COVID-19 on the global economy. https://t.co/OuBTXkbGSJ #coronavirus https://t.co/4CQO28OJkY
LIVE NOW: Press briefing on #COVID19 by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and @WorldBank Group President David Malpass. Watch here: https://t.co/tEh2VdmuUf #coronavirus https://t.co/i7B8DXJ3WG

We are confident that, working together, we will overcome the challenge facing us and restore growth and prosperity for all. #coronavirus

Read the full IMFC statement: https://t.co/4lhMZrgHgv

We are determined to provide the necessary support to mitigate the impact, especially on the most vulnerable people and countries. We have called upon the IMF to use all its available financing instruments to help member countries in need. #coronavirus

IMFC on #coronavirus: The 189 member countries stand united to address the challenges related to the epidemic. We extend our sympathies to those affected. The economic and financial impact has been felt globally, creating uncertainty and damaging near-term prospects. https://t.co/9xW0LFskL0

Join us LIVE at 9am EST (2pm GMT) this morning for a press briefing by IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and @WorldBank Group President David Malpass on #COVID19. Watch here: https://t.co/tEh2VdmuUf #coronavirus https://t.co/i7B8DXJ3WG

#Cyprus has repaid the IMF 6 years ahead of schedule. With strong growth and favorable market access, the country last week paid €717 mln still outstanding from the €1 bln loan approved in 2013 as part of an European support package to help stabilize its financial system. https://t.co/61AoYFwTZw
Despite being more educated than their parents, #millennials may have less job stability during their working life. https://t.co/S4vdAhlWsK #IMFBlog

IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva and @WorldBank Group President David Malpass will hold a press briefing on #COVID19 tomorrow, March 4 at 9am EST. Watch LIVE here: https://t.co/tEh2VdmuUf #coronavirus https://t.co/i7B8DXJ3WG
The 2020 Spring Meetings will be held virtually this year, to ensure the health and safety of participants and staff given health concerns around #COVID19. https://t.co/Rxxvk3KpvF

IMF’s DMD Zhang: Very happy to have met with Monsha’at, the Saudi #SME authority, and some young entrepreneurs today with Tim Callen to discuss the opportunities and challenges for small businesses to grow and create jobs. https://t.co/ZGi7V3yMWe

.@KGeorgieva: Deeply concerned by the #coronavirus, the IMF and @WorldBank will implement a plan to adapt the 2020 IMF-World Bank Spring Meetings to a virtual format. Our priority is to ensure the health and safety of participants and staff. https://t.co/TEszgYBFJR #IMFmeetings https://t.co/xpX5iEsx02

Demographics can shape a country’s destiny. But policy choices matter. Our latest issue of F&D Magazine focuses on demographic shifts taking place globally and how the right policies can help people live longer, happier, and more productive lives. ⁠https://t.co/wVbFRkjmmX

Internet banking in #Malaysia has quadrupled in the last decade, topping a 90% usage rate in 2018. Here is a look at Malaysia’s flourishing #fintech ecosystem. https://t.co/YXCY3fJe2f #IMFCountryFocus

.@KGeorgieva: The IMF and the @WorldBank stand ready to help countries address the challenge of COVID-19. We are engaged with partner institutions and countries, with attention to those where health systems are weak and people most vulnerable. https://t.co/dGM8sUsVHj https://t.co/DYQZtump1W

The economic costs climate change confront us. IMF staff estimates show that a typical climate-related natural disaster reduces growth by an average of 0.4 percentage points in the affected country in the year of the event. https://t.co/381oDGLW9Y #IMFBlog https://t.co/LC9r6M7dyd

In low-income countries, the average literacy rate for men is about 70% while it’s only 54% for women. Fiscal policies that support better access to education can ultimately help equip women for jobs in more skill-intensive sectors https://t.co/MT30Cry0wj #IMFBlog #IMFIPF #Gender https://t.co/MBA7WU2CHx

Does greater product market competition improve external competitiveness and growth? A new IMF working paper examines this question by using country-and firm-level data for a sample of 39 sub-Saharan African countries. https://t.co/I1kB30G7y9 #IMFAfrica

Uncertainty is weighing on the global economy. But there are 3 areas where policymakers can make a big difference—trade is one area. What are the other two? Read more to find out. https://t.co/gSYn1KhMXQ #IMFBlog https://t.co/MiWBRgkvXl

After a marked slowdown last year, global economic activity is expected to strengthen moderately in 2020. But new risks have emerged recently, notably from the #coronavirus. More in the latest IMF #G20 Note. https://t.co/GzQm2pTyGL https://t.co/qWv2zNcYJl

Azour: My visit to #Algeria was productive. I exchanged views with the authorities on their economic policies including creating jobs for its growing population. .@KGeorgieva: This is a historic moment. It provides clear recognition of Somalia’s sustained commitment to economic reforms. It paves the way for #Somalia to access more resources to increase growth and reduce poverty. Read the report https://t.co/uS5fqFl57L

IMF and World Bank consider #Somalia eligible for debt relief on initial assessment. This is an important milestone toward writing-off most of Somalia’s $5.3 billion debt.   https://t.co/BU6M4zya0G https://t.co/I10cuTuH15
